meanings.definition: To separate or divide into smaller parts
meanings.sent1: The toy car demerged into its individual pieces.
meanings.sent2: She demerged the puzzle into smaller sections to solve it easily.
meanings.sent3: The magician demerged the colorful scarf into many tiny ribbons.
meanings.sent4: The river demerged into several smaller streams as it flowed downhill.
meanings.sent5: The artist demerged the painting into distinct shapes and colors for a unique effect.

meanings.definition: To undo a merger, especially of companies
meanings.sent1: The two companies demerged after facing financial difficulties.
meanings.sent2: The decision was made to demerge the businesses to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The plan to demerge the merged companies left everyone surprised.
meanings.sent4: The CEO's strategy was to demerge the failing branches for better management.
meanings.sent5: The shareholders voted to demerge the conglomerate into separate entities.

meanings.sent1: The rock demerged into smaller pieces after the explosion.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge demerged under the weight of the heavy truck.
meanings.sent3: The cookie demerged into crumbs when it fell on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The ice sculpture demerged in the warm sunlight, losing its shape.
meanings.sent5: The friendship demerged slowly over time due to misunderstandings.
